comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110615151330

Steps to reproduce:

Open "Week"-View (click in the Calendar on the right the "week" button).


Actual results:

One single week is shown from week-start (e.g. Monday) till week-end (e.g. Sunday).


Expected results:

Would be great to have an option to set (as for multi-week view), that one week is displayed, starting with the current day (not on week-start) and an option how many previous days should be shown (the current behaviour could set as option "variable").
So if today is Thursday and you set one week view, with one previous day, the view will start on Wednesday and show all 7 days from Wednesday till Tuesday next week.

Steps to reproduce:

Open "Week"-View (click in the Calendar on the right the "week" button).


Actual results:

One single week is shown from week-start (e.g. Monday) till week-end (e.g. Sunday).


Expected results:

Would be great to have an option to set (as for multi-week view), that one week is displayed, starting with the current day (not on week-start) and an option how many previous days should be shown (the current behaviour could set as option "variable").
So if today is Thursday and you set one week view, with one previous day, the view will start on Wednesday and show all 7 days from Wednesday till Tuesday next week.

comments.text: *** Bug 767722 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

comments.raw_text: As an alternative solution, I would recommend to offer the options "Yesterday" and/or "Today" in the configuration of the "First day of Week".
comments.text: As an alternative solution, I would recommend to offer the options "Yesterday" and/or "Today" in the configuration of the "First day of Week".
